name: E. Sereja and Two Sequences
statement:
Sereja has two sequences and , consisting of integers. One day Sereja
got bored and he decided two play with them. The rules of the game was
very simple. Sereja makes several moves, in one move he can perform one
of the following actions: Choose several (at least one) first elements
of sequence (non-empty prefix of ), choose several (at least one) first
elements of sequence (non-empty prefix of ); the element of sequence
with the maximum index among the chosen ones must be equal to the
element of sequence with the maximum index among the chosen ones; remove
the chosen elements from the sequences. Remove all elements of both
sequences. The first action is worth energy units and adds one dollar to
Sereja’s electronic account. The second action is worth the number of
energy units equal to the number of elements Sereja removed from the
sequences before performing this action. After Sereja performed the
second action, he gets all the money that he earned on his electronic
account during the game.Initially Sereja has energy units and no money
on his account. What maximum number of money can Sereja get? Note, the
amount of Seraja’s energy mustn’t be negative at any time moment.
